text: When using the JavaScript `fetch` API to make a POST request with a JSON payload, which of the following `headers` is typically required for the server to correctly interpret the body?
What is the purpose of the `x-init` directive in Alpine.js, as seen in `multi_choice_quiz/templates/multi_choice_quiz/index.html`?
What happens if you use x-ref="itemElement" on an element that is inside an x-for loop in Alpine.js?
What is the primary purpose of the `x-bind` directive (or its common shorthand `:`) in Alpine.js?
What is the primary role of the `x-trap.inert` directive when building an accessible modal dialog with Alpine.js?
If you use a simple x-transition directive without specifying individual stage classes (e.g., div x-show="show" x-transition.../div), what kind of default animation does Alpine.js typically apply?
To test custom validation logic in a Django model's `clean()` method or field validators, which model method should you typically call on an instance before asserting for `ValidationError`?

When running Gunicorn for a Django application inside a Docker container (e.g., for Cloud Run), why is it important to bind to `0.0.0.0` (e.g., `gunicorn myproject.wsgi:application --bind 0.0.0.0:$PORT`)?
If your Cloud Run service needs to connect to a Cloud SQL instance with a private IP address, what additional GCP networking component is typically required?
When testing Django authentication workflows, what is the primary role of `django.test.Client`?
In an HTMX-enhanced Django formset, why is it crucial to correctly manage form prefixes (e.g., `form-0`, `form-1`) and potentially pass a `form_idx` when adding new forms dynamically?

When a <form> element wraps multiple filter inputs (e.g., search box, category checkboxes) and has HTMX attributes for triggering requests, how are the values of all filters typically included in the HTMX request?

If you use the Django template tag `{{ my_django_data|json_script:"myDataId" }}` to embed data, how would you typically access and parse this data to initialize an Alpine.js component's state via `x-data`?
When creating an `HtmxTemplateMixin` for Django Class-Based Views to serve different templates for HTMX and standard requests, which CBV method is typically overridden to implement this logic?
How can an HTMX AJAX request be programmatically cancelled using JavaScript and HTMX events?
What is the main function of the `hx-sync` attribute in HTMX?
If an inline edit form, submitted via HTMX, fails server-side validation in Django, what is the recommended response from the server?
When using `hx-ws="send"` on an HTML form element, what does HTMX typically do upon form submission?
After a user successfully saves changes through an inline edit form submitted via HTMX, what should the Django server typically return?
What is generally the recommended and more robust approach for including the HTMX JavaScript library in a production Django project?
What critical server-side requirement must be met when using `hx-push-url` for HTMX-driven navigation?
If an element has `hx-sync="this:drop"`, how does it affect new HTMX requests if a request from this element is already in flight?
What is a common and effective HTMX pattern for closing a modal whose content is loaded into a `div` with `id="modal-wrapper"`?
When implementing inline editing with HTMX, what is the typical server response when an "Edit" button is clicked for a piece of content?
When implementing dynamic tabs with HTMX, what is a common setup for the hx-target attribute on the tab buttons?

Which of the following settings is essential for `django-allauth` due to its use of `django.contrib.sites`? 

# project/settings.py
# ??? = 1

Consider the following Django settings snippet: 

INSTALLED_APPS = [
    # ... other apps ...
    'django.contrib.auth',
    'django.contrib.contenttypes',
    'django.contrib.sessions',
    # ...
]
Why is `'django.contrib.contenttypes'` essential for Django's authentication system?

What is the primary purpose of the `django.contrib.contenttypes` framework in relation to Django's permission system?
If you create a custom User model named `MyUser` in an app called `accounts`, what should the `AUTH_USER_MODEL` setting in `settings.py` be?
What is the primary purpose of the `SOCIALACCOUNT_PROVIDERS` setting in `django-allauth`?
What is Django's primary defense mechanism against Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities within its template system?
How can you display a calculated value or the result of a model method as a column in the Django admin's change list view?
How should you reference the active User model when defining a `ForeignKey` in another model (e.g., a `Post` model with an `author` field)?
When using `django-allauth`, where do you typically configure the Client ID and Client Secret for a social provider like Google?
In Django's typical request-response cycle for a protected resource, which process must occur first?
How does Django's CsrfViewMiddleware primarily protect against Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks?
What is the purpose of HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) and settings like `SECURE_HSTS_SECONDS`?
When creating a simple read-only API endpoint using Django REST Framework to list all Article objects, which generic view is most commonly used?
If multiple decorators are applied to a single Django view function, in what order are they typically applied and executed?
